intro: Sulcorebutia corroana, commonly known as the desert rose or coral cactus, is a species of flowering cactus native to the arid regions of South America. It is characterized by its compact, globular shape and its ability to store water in its thick, fleshy stems. The plant produces showy, pink or red flowers during the warmer months, adding a striking visual element to its appearance. Its leaves are typically reduced to spines, which help reduce water loss in its harsh environment. Sulcorebutia corroana is well-suited for cultivation in dry climates and requires minimal care once established.
